info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON, CLERMONT, WEST CENTRAL BROWN AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wyoming to near Falmouth, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Blue Ash, Loveland, Montgomery, Madeira, Milford, Forestville, Amelia, Mariemont, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Batavia, Augusta, Morrow, Felicity, Camp Dennison, Remington, Plainville and Coldstream. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
